questions.question: What tag do we use in HTML to denote the main part of the document inside which we define the page elements?

answers.option: should be embedded inside an HTML document
runs directly in a web browser and can contain an HTML document inside it
may be embedded inside an HTML document or run standalone in the browser

questions.question: Entering about:blank in the address bar of your browser will:

answers.option: reset the browser to its default settings
generate a page with information about the browser's statuts and send it to the developer.
generate and load a minimal blank HTML page into the current tab.
open a tab with information about your browser

questions.question: The basic toolkit needed to effectively develop JavaScript code consists of two elements:
What is not the task of the interpreter?

answers.option: Creating a runtime environment for the program.
Verifying the correctness of the program source code(sintax).
Transforming all program code into target code before execution.
Transforming the individual commands of the source code into the target form.

questions.question: Where will we definitely not be able to execute JavaScript code?

answers.option: In a server environment using node.js.
A new language based on JavaScript which, among other things, introduces static typing.
A variant of JavaScript that is compiled rather than interpreted.
The original name for JavaScript, which has been changed over time.
A language for describing the structure of a web page.
A scripting language to support mathematical calculations.

questions.question: In a browser, we want to open a local file by typing the path to it in the address bar. The path must be preceded by:
Using JavaScript, we want to display the word 'test' in the console. What statement do we use to do this?:
In the browser, we type into the address bar a string starting with file://. This means that:

answers.option: We do not want to open the page, but only download a file from the remote address and save it on the local machine.
We want the browser to create an empty page for us with the name we give as a continuation of the string.
We want to save the page as a local file.
The rest of the string is the path to the file on our local computer that we want to open in the browser.

questions.question: The javaScript code includes the console.log('http://test.org'); command. Its ejecution will:

answers.option: Display on the console information about the progress of http://test.org page loading.
Cause the page http://test.org to be loadde into the browser.
Send a log with information about the currently executed script to the indicated address http://test.org
Display the following message on the console: 'http://test.org'.
